name: E. Maxim and Calculator
statement:
Maxim has got a calculator. The calculator has two integer cells.
Initially, the first cell contains number , and the second cell contains
number . In one move you can perform one of the following operations:
Let’s assume that at the current time the first cell contains number ,
and the second cell contains number . Write to the second cell number ;
Let’s assume that at the current time the first cell contains number ,
and the second cell contains number . Write to the first cell number .
Maxim is wondering, how many integers are there, such that we can write
the number to the first cell of the calculator, having performed at most
moves.
